Hi, I have given up on Hubl. I have created custom templates. The date and time function is always off regarding the time of the events that are from the database. I live in the pacific los angeles time zone here and my time is always off. I have tried everything possible with getting the time accurate. I am not sure why the time isn't working as intended.  The template I create is broken I had to adjust the timestamp to get an accurate time zone but why do I need to do all that. Here's an example I have an event that is in the database as 05-15-2023 @ 5pm when pulled directly from the DB to hubl with los angeles time zone setting in the account using only the format_time('hh:mm a','America/Los_Angeles') function it comes out as 10:42 am. I have given up on this it randomly broke via timezone, I think Hubl is terrible, I am an experienced developer that would be the first to say the time and dates should be the easiest things to manage to get right like in javascript or PHP for example.  I don't think that Hubl is fully polished for professional use and needs to be fixed because it puts unnecessary pressure on developers with baffled content managers having unrealistic expectations but I don't blame them when it does look correct from their point of view. Why are the timezones so hard to manage in Hubl?
